orbotix.macro
Class MacroObject

java.lang.Object
  orbotix.macro.MacroObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class MacroObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Macros, are executed on the robot. Use this class to build macros by adding and removing commands that are subclasses of the MacroCommand object.

Modes

The default mode is MacroObject.MacroObjectMode.Normal and is limited to 240B. The other modes are:
  • MacroObject.MacroObjectMode.CachedStreaming : Unlimited size, streamed (Note: Bluetooth intensive)
  • MacroObject.MacroObjectMode.Chunky : 1K limit, 240B chunks, executed on load complete

Commands

TODO: enumerated list

Example

      
      //Create a new macro object to send to Sphero
      MacroObject fadeMacro = new MacroObject();
      fadeMacro.addCommand(new LoopStart(loopValue));

      // Fade the color from the current to purple
      fadeMacro.addCommand(new Fade(0, 255, 255, delayValue));

      // You must delay because, like the roll command, this does not delay for you
      fadeMacro.addCommand(new Delay(delayValue));

      // Fade the color from purple to yellow
      fadeMacro.addCommand(new Fade(255, 0, 255, delayValue));
      fadeMacro.addCommand(new Delay(delayValue));

      // Fade the color from yellow to whatever this next color is
      fadeMacro.addCommand(new Fade(255, 255, 0, delayValue));
      fadeMacro.addCommand(new Delay(delayValue));
      fadeMacro.addCommand(new LoopEnd());

      sphero.executeMacro(fadeMacro);

See Also:
MacroObject.MacroObjectMode, Serialized Form

setRunAfterLoading

public void setRunAfterLoading(boolean run)
If set to false, then a MacroObject.MacroObjectMode.Chunky macro will not run immediately after completeyl uploading the macro to the Robot. By default, this is true. If this is set to false, the macro must be run at some later point with the RunMacroCommand in order to run the macro. This is useful when combined with the setOnMacroUploadedListener(orbotix.macro.MacroObject.OnMacroUploadedListener) method, to evaluate when the macro has finished uploading.

Parameters:
run - Whether to run the macro immediately after uploading to the robot. Default is true.

An array containing MacroObject subclasses that make up the macro
